intro: Petrocoptis pardoi, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Native to arid and rocky regions, this plant is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It typically grows on limestone or rocky substrates and is often found in mountainous areas. Petrocoptis pardoi is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
